author: AFP
title: 7.1 magnitude earthquake hits off Japan: USGS | Jordan Times
text:
TOKYO ‚Äî A powerful 7.1-magnitude earthquake struck off southern Japan on Thursday, the United States Geological Survey said, with the local meteorological agency warning of tsunamis striking coastal areas.
The quake hit at 4:42 pm (0742 GMT) off Kyushu at a depth of 25 kilometres, the US agency said.
The USGS had initially reported two strong quakes, with magnitudes of 6.9 and 7.1, but later said there had only been one tremor.
"This error has been fixed. There was one event," the USGS said.
The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) also reported a single quake with a magnitude of 7.1.
"Tsunamis will strike repeatedly. Please do not enter the sea or approach the coast until the warning is lifted," the JMA said on X.
There were no immediate reports of any damage.
The Japanese government set up a special task force in response to the quakes, according to a statement.
Tsunamis of up to one metre were initially expected to arrive or had arrived in some coastal areas in Kyushu and Shikoku islands, broadcaster NHK reported.
Sitting on top of four major tectonic plates along the western edge of the Pacific "Ring of Fire", Japan is one of the world's most tectonically active countries.
The archipelago, home to around 125 million people, experiences around 1,500 jolts every year and accounts for around 18 percent of the world's earthquakes.
The vast majority are mild, although the damage they cause varies according to their location and the depth below the Earth's surface at which they strike.
Still, even large quakes usually cause little damage thanks to special construction techniques and strict building regulations in the world's number four economy.
On New Year's Day, at least 318 people died after an earthquake hit the Noto peninsula on the Sea of Japan side of the main island of Honshu.
The January 1 quake and its aftershocks toppled buildings, caused fires and knocked out infrastructure at a time when families were celebrating the new year.
Japan has strict construction regulations intended to ensure buildings can withstand strong earthquakes, and routinely holds emergency drills to prepare for a major jolt.
But the country is haunted by the memory of a colossal 9.0-magnitude undersea quake off northeastern Japan in March 2011 which triggered a tsunami that left around 18,500 people dead or missing.
The 2011 tsunami also sent three reactors into meltdown at the Fukushima nuclear plant, causing Japan's worst post-war disaster and the most serious nuclear accident since Chernobyl.
In March 2022, a 7.4-magnitude quake off the coast of Fukushima shook large areas of eastern Japan, killing three people.
The capital Tokyo was devastated by a huge earthquake a century ago in 1923.

author: Express News Service
title: Saroj Goenka, daughter-in-law of media icon Ramnath Goenka, cremated; prayer meeting on Sunday
text:
CHENNAI: Saroj Goenka, daughter-in-law of the legendary media baron Ramnath Goenka, passed away at her home in Chennai on Friday. Her youngest daughter Kavita Singhania was by her side when the end came at 11.30 am. She was 95.
Saroj is the daughter of Shreyans Prasad Jain, after whom the SP Jain College in Mumbai is named. She was cremated at 5.30 pm at the Besant Nagar electrical crematorium. A condolence meeting will be held on Sunday between 2 pm and 4 pm at her Express Estate residence.
Born on August 29, 1929, Saroj married Ramnath Goenka‚Äôs son Bhagwan Das Goenka. After the untimely demise of her spouse in 1979, she took over as the managing director of The Indian Express (Madurai) Ltd, a position she held till 1995. She was president of Indian Newspaper Society in 1984-85.
Saroj later became chairperson of Express Infrastructure Ltd, which runs the tony Express Avenue mall on Mount Road. On August 30, 2010, the then chief minister M Karunanidhi inaugurated Express Avenue. ‚ÄúExpress Avenue is like a crowning memorial for the services rendered by Ramnath Goenka, the doyen of Indian journalism,‚Äô‚Äô Karunanidhi said while speaking on the occasion.
Affectionately called Amma, Saroj was well known for her charitable activities like running an orphanage, the Daya Sadan Childrens Town at Nerkundram in the city. For a long time, she made weekly visits to Daya Sadan on Saturdays to personally oversee its functioning.
She also ran the Moongibai Goenka Girls Higher Secondary School at Sowcarpet in Chennai. Named after her mother-in-law, the school was started in 1949. Saroj is survived by three daughters, Arati Agarwal, Ritu Goenka, and Kavita Singhania.
Condoling the demise, Sudha Ravi, a long-time friend of Saroj, recalled that she was a good student of Vedanta under Swami Paramarthananda. She used to attend the Swamiji‚Äôs classes regularly and completed the study of many Upanishads and Vedantic texts, she said.
Sudha is a trustee of the Gandhigram Khadi and Village Industries Public Charitable Trust. She said that Saroj was a great supporter of the Crafts Council of India. ‚ÄúShe was a wonderful human being ‚Äî very kind, very warm,‚Äù Sudha reminisced.

author: world today news
title: Flamengo‚Äôs Deliberative Council Unanimously Approves New Shirt Sponsorship Deal Worth R$170 Million with Pixbet
text: Share with the friends Voting took place this Thursday (28), in G√°vea In a meeting held this Thursday (28), Flamengo‚Äôs Deliberative Council approved the new master sponsorship of the shirt. It will be the company Pixbet, for the value of R$170 million, for a two-year contract. Initially, the club receives R$20 million. Then, five more installments of R$30 will fall into the red-and-black coffers. millions . üö® URGENT: Flamengo approves new sponsorship with PIXBET. Company starts to print brand in the most noble part of Manto for 2 years, paying R$ 170 million (R$ 85 million/year). Did you like the change? ü§î [#colunadofla] [pic.twitter.com/hH5uYFBOi8] ‚Äî Column by Fla | Flamengo (@ColunadoFla) [December 28, 2023] The vote was unanimous, with 125 advisors in favor of Pixbet as Flamengo‚Äôs master sponsor. In this way, the current brand that occupies the prime space on the shirt (on the belly), Banco BRB, will remain on the shoulder blade, for R$6.25 million, for three months. The financial institution had the option of covering the amounts presented by the bookmaker, but did not implement the clause. ANOTHER SPONSORSHIP Also on Thursday night (28), ABC da Constru√ß√£o, which features the brand on Flamengo‚Äôs shorts, increased its prices and reached its fourth season of partnership with the club. In this way, it went from R$6.3 million to R$7.1 million. Payment will be made with R$5.2 million in direct funds and another R$1.9 million in exchange. According to a note published by Flamengo, the company will print the logo on the back of the game and training shorts of the men‚Äôs, women ‚Äôs and U20 football teams and the basketball team until December 31, 2024. Therefore, it will part of investments in marketing focused on the national expansion plan. SHIRT VALUE Now, with the renovations, the Flamengo shirt now has an annual value of R$225 million. The debut of the Manto with the brand relocations is scheduled to take place in January 2024, during the tour to the United States and also at the Campeonato Carioca. The first game in the state takes place on the 17th, against Audax, in Manaus. In North America, Meng√£o faces Orlando City ( USA ), in a friendly. Share with the friends 2023-12-28 23:12:45 #Flamengo #approves #master #sponsorship #R170 #million

author: Susie Beever
title: Storm Gerrit: Nail-biting video shows police pilots bouncing in 'flying washing machine' - Mirror Online
text:
Chopper pilots have shared the terrifying view from a police helicopter whilst being thrown around the sky by Storm Gerrit.
This was the moment a National Police Air Service helicopter was transformed into a "flying washing machine" as it hit the tempest over London on Thursday. Airborne officers commanding the aircraft shared the clip with green-faced emojis as the storm swept in, wreaking havoc across the UK.
Writing on X, formerly known as Twitter , NPAS London pilots said: "If you think it‚Äôs windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine!" They added: "Thankfully, we have recent taken delivery of some extra sick bags. None have been required‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ yet!"
The pilots weren't the only ones in the sky to struggle in the strong gusts this week, however. One American Airlines flight faced a very bumpy landing at Heathrow on Wednesday amidst the severe windy conditions from the named storm.
BigJetTV captured the nailbiting moment the flight from Los Angeles touched down as it was thrown side to side by strong gusts. The airline enthusiast filming the landing can be heard shouting "oh" over and over as the aircraft makes its shaky landing, before yelling, "stop it!"
Meanwhile, British Airways planes were captured making similarly treacherous landings at Bristol Airport on Wednesday. The vehement gusts meant one aircraft had to make three attempts to land, while others were filmed being thrown about by the storm above the runway.
The Met Office issued several weather warnings earlier this week for strong wind and heavy rain, as well as snow in parts of Scotland and the Shetland Islands. Forecasters named the storm Gerrit as a warning to Brits hitting the road or heading outdoors during the post-Christmas week, with concerns the severe weather would unleash travel chaos and power cuts.

author: Monae Stevens
title: Daughter surprises parents with new house for Christmas
text:
SELMA, Ala. ( WSFA /Gray News) - An Alabama couple will start the new year in a new home thanks to their daughter.
Krystal Hardy-Allen said she has always dreamed of buying her parents a house since childhood.
‚ÄúFor years, I have wanted to bring that to fruition for my parents,‚Äù Hardy-Allen said.
Hardy-Allen purchased a historic property in the Selma downtown area in November 2022.
She hired her father to oversee renovations as the head contractor, not knowing he was renovating a home for himself and his wife.
The renovations were on track to be complete by January 2023, but one week before the big reveal, a tornado demolished part of the home, forcing the family to start from scratch.
However, that did not stop Hardy-Allen‚Äôs plan.
The family worked together to complete the renovations, and she kept the secret going until handing over the keys to her parents on Christmas Eve.
‚ÄúI took them upstairs and told them the real reason why we were all here was not to sell the house but to make sure they had the keys to their new home,‚Äù Hardy-Allen said.
The parents will also not have to pay a mortgage on the property.
Copyright 2023 WSFA via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: RMC avec AFP
title: Crues: Christophe B√©chu annonce la reconnaissance de catastrophe naturelle en Mayenne
text:
Le ministre de la Transition √©cologique, Christophe B√©chu, a annonc√© vendredi la reconnaissance de l'√©tat de catastrophe naturelle pour les communes de d√©partement de la Mayenne touch√©es par la crue historique de l'Oudon, notamment Craon o√π il s'est rendu dans la matin√©e. Le ministre de la Transition √©cologique, Christophe B√©chu , a annonc√© vendredi la reconnaissance de l'√©tat de catastrophe naturelle pour les communes du d√©partement de la Mayenne touch√©es par la crue historique de l'Oudon, notamment Craon o√π il s'est rendu dans la matin√©e.
Proc√©dure engag√©e "d√®s la mi-juillet" La proc√©dure de reconnaissance de catastrophe naturelle devrait √™tre engag√©e "d√®s la mi-juillet", et permettra "d'accompagner les sinistr√©s" et de prendre en charge "l'essentiel du co√ªt des d√©g√¢ts" pour toutes les communes touch√©es par ces inondations, a annonc√© Christophe B√©chu.
Interrog√© sur les communes qui pourront en b√©n√©ficier, le ministre a indiqu√© que ce serait "aux √©lus locaux et √† la pr√©fecture de d√©terminer" les "limites administratives, g√©ographiques exactes".
A Craon, le ministre Christophe B√©chu a adress√© un message de "vigilance" aux Fran√ßais leur demandant de "vraiment tenir compte des pr√©visions".
Les vigilances crues ne cessent d'augmenter "Depuis huit mois (...) nous avons d√©pass√© la 100e alerte de vigilance orange ou rouge aux crues. Sur les 20 derni√®res ann√©es, on n'avait jamais d√©pass√© 40 pour vous donner un ordre de grandeur de ce qu'on est en train de vivre", a d√©clar√© M. B√©chu.
La vigilance rouge pour crues a √©t√© lev√©e vendredi pour les d√©partements de la Mayenne et de Maine-et-Loire, repass√©s en jaune dans l'apr√®s-midi au lendemain d'une crue historique de l'Oudon √† Craon. Le centre de cette ville de 4.500 habitants s'est retrouv√© sous les eaux jeudi, entra√Ænant l'√©vacuation de dizaines de personnes.
"L'√©quivalent de 135 litres d'eau par m2" en 4h Le bassin de l'Oudon a v√©cu "une crue absolument exceptionnelle", puisque "en l'espace de quatre heures, il est tomb√© l'√©quivalent de 135 litres d'eau par m2, c'est-√†-dire l'√©quivalent de ce qui tombe normalement plut√¥t en l'espace de quatre mois", a soulign√© le ministre.
Le niveau de l'eau "a bien baiss√©, il n'y a plus d'eau dans les rues", a d√©clar√© √† l'AFP Bertrand de Gu√©briant, maire de Craon. L'Oudon y avait atteint jeudi un pic de 3,25 m en d√©but d'apr√®s-midi, bien au-del√† de la "crue historique" de 1996 (2,86 m), selon les mesures de Vigicrues. Il √©tait redescendu en-dessous de 2 m vendredi en fin de journ√©e et la tendance restait √† la baisse sur les prochaines heures.
Selon la mairie, les pompiers visitaient les habitations touch√©es par les inondations pour s'assurer que les installations √©lectriques n'ont pas √©t√© impact√©es et r√©tablir le courant dans les meilleurs d√©lais. Au total, 18 personnes √©vacu√©es ont √©t√© accueillies dans le camping municipal, a indiqu√© le maire de Craon. D'autres ont √©t√© h√©berg√©es chez des proches.
"Une table qui flottait dans le jardin" "Depuis 1948 que j'habite ici, je n'avais jamais vu √ßa", avait assur√© jeudi Henri Robert, 78 ans. "Quand je suis parti vers midi, j'avais une table qui flottait dans le jardin et plus de 20 cm d'eau dans la maison".
Vendredi √† 16h, seuls les d√©partements de l'Is√®re et de la Savoie restaient plac√©s en vigilance orange pour les crues, selon M√©t√©o-France.
En Is√®re, "une centaine de personnes" ont √©t√© √©vacu√©es "en un temps record" au moyen de quatre h√©licopt√®res du hameau de la B√©rarde, s'est f√©licit√© le pr√©fet Louis Laugier, dans une vid√©o publi√©e par Le Dauphin√© lib√©r√©.
Situ√© sur la commune de Saint-Christophe-en-Oisans, ce hameau s'est retrouv√© isol√© depuis la coupure, jeudi, de la route d√©partementale par une crue diluvienne du torrent du V√©n√©on.
Un poste m√©dical avanc√© a √©t√© mis sur pied pour les d√©plac√©s mais "nous n'avons pas connaissance de victimes", a soulign√© le pr√©fet de l'Is√®re, qui n'avait pas d'√©valuation pr√©cise des d√©g√¢ts dans le hameau √† ce stade.
Sur le m√™me sujet M√©t√©o: deux d√©partements en vigilance orange crues "√áa continue √† couler. Simplement on voit bien que certains chalets ont √©t√© emport√©s (...) Des personnes sont pass√©es pas loin de se faire emporter par les eaux et ont √©t√© secourues au dernier moment gr√¢ce √† ce syst√®me de noria d'h√©licopt√®res", a d√©clar√© le pr√©fet.

author: VIA Empresa
title: VRAIn, la startup catalana que revoluciona la visualizaci√≥n de im√°genes m√©dicas con realidad virtual
text:
Daniel Esteban-Ferrer, emprendedor e ingeniero de telecomunicaciones, doctor en nanotecnolog√≠a y con un postdoctorado en realidad virtual, detect√≥ un problema com√∫n: los m√©dicos necesitaban una mejor manera de visualizar im√°genes multidimensionales, de tres o cuatro dimensiones. Las pantallas planas limitan la representaci√≥n y hacen que se pierda hasta el 99 % de la informaci√≥n.
Ante esta necesidad naci√≥ VRAIn, una startup catalana de healthtech dedicada a la visualizaci√≥n inmersiva de im√°genes biom√©dicas, como las de una resonancia o un TAC. Su tecnolog√≠a permite ver estas im√°genes en un entorno completamente tridimensional, como si fueran hologramas, y no solo en una pantalla. Adem√°s, incorpora inteligencia artificial que automatiza el an√°lisis de los datos, haci√©ndola mucho m√°s r√°pida y eficiente que el trabajo manual de un m√©dico.
La tecnolog√≠a de VRAIn permite ver estas im√°genes en un entorno completamente tridimensional, como si fueran hologramas, y no solo en una pantalla
Con la premisa de ofrecer a los m√©dicos una herramienta que automatice las tareas repetitivas y tediosas, lo que les permite dedicarse a atender a los pacientes e investigar, VRAIn utiliza la realidad virtual y la inteligencia artificial para crear y analizar bioim√°genes 3D de una manera innovadora. Esteban-Ferrer, CEO y fundador, cre√≥ la empresa en 2020, y actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de Barcelona Activa.
VRAIn desarrolla una tecnolog√≠a para ver ecograf√≠as prenatales
VRAIn sali√≥ al mercado con el lanzamiento de su primer producto, BabyVR, una herramienta que permite visualizar ecograf√≠as prenatales de manera inmersiva mediante realidad virtual y aumentada. ‚ÄúAhora estamos trabajando en otro producto, que se llama AthleteVR, orientado a la visualizaci√≥n de im√°genes biom√©dicas aplicadas al deporte. Lo presentamos en el Mobile World Congress y, actualmente, ya contamos con tres pruebas piloto pagadas‚Äù, explica Esteban-Ferrer a VIA Empresa.
Esteban-Ferrer apunta que AthleteVR ‚Äúya se est√° utilizando para mejorar la participaci√≥n de los pacientes y apoyar tratamientos no invasivos y de vanguardia, en algunos casos como alternativas a la cirug√≠a‚Äù. Visualizar detalles sutiles y cr√≠ticos de una lesi√≥n es dif√≠cil con im√°genes 2D convencionales. AthleteVR transforma las resonancias magn√©ticas en experiencias 3D con realidad virtual, que permiten a los pacientes comprender mejor su afecci√≥n y participar activamente en la toma de decisiones junto con sus m√©dicos.
Esteban-Ferrer (VRAIn): ‚ÄúAhora estamos trabajando en otro producto, que se llama AthleteVR, orientado a la visualizaci√≥n de im√°genes biom√©dicas aplicadas al deporte"
Actualmente, la empresa emergente colabora con varios hospitales, cl√≠nicas y universidades de medicina. Destacan, entre otros, la cl√≠nica Kroton, responsable de los servicios m√©dicos de varios clubes deportivos profesionales de Lleida, y Elit Medicine & Sports Lab, en Sant Cugat del Vall√®s. En cuanto a BabyVR, cuentan con diez clientes, uno de ellos en el Reino Unido, y con AthleteVR trabajan con tres cl√≠nicas privadas en Catalunya. Adem√°s, ya disponen de agentes comerciales en Estados Unidos y en el Reino Unido.
VRAIn prev√© cerrar el a√±o con 110.000 euros
Hasta ahora, la startup ha conseguido una facturaci√≥n de 15.000 euros y prev√© cerrar el a√±o con 110.000 euros. El a√±o pasado cerr√≥ una ronda de inversi√≥n de 202.000 euros con el objetivo de impulsar el proyecto en los mercados internacionales con el lanzamiento de su primer producto, BabyVR. Actualmente, la empresa busca una nueva ronda de un mill√≥n de euros (de los cuales ya hay 600.000 euros comprometidos) para continuar con su expansi√≥n.
En cuanto al futuro, a corto plazo el objetivo es llegar a clubes de f√∫tbol de primera divisi√≥n. ‚ÄúNuestra idea es trabajar con clubes de Espa√±a y de Europa, pero ya tenemos agentes en Estados Unidos y en el Reino Unido. Esto significa que la Premier League tambi√©n es un objetivo, y en Estados Unidos estamos explorando oportunidades en f√∫tbol americano y en la NBA‚Äù, explica Esteban-Ferrer. Adem√°s, esperan crecer de manera sostenida y org√°nica a trav√©s de la colaboraci√≥n con estos clubes, con la intenci√≥n de duplicar la plantilla el a√±o que viene.

author: itaizul0011
title: Farmers embrace green energy to boost efficiency of tractors ‚Äì Hydrogen electrolysis helps to cut emissions and allows heavy farming equipment to run for hours
text:
Farmers embrace green energy to boost efficiency of tractors ‚Äì Hydrogen electrolysis helps to cut emissions and allows heavy farming equipment to run for hours
Renewable energy sources such as green hydrogen are vital to ensuring the agricultural sector contributes to Scotland‚Äôs move to net zero.
Some farmers are using hydrogen electrolysis, which utilises solar power to make hydrogen gas from water, in a bid to help cut emissions and run heavy farming equipment for hours.
It comes as farmers face growing pressure to meet climate targets while keeping their businesses viable.
Aberdeenshire farmer David Smith, 82, believes that hydrogen electrolysis could be a solution for a range of farm equipment.
For the past eight years, he has used a hydrogen electrolyser to increase the efficiency of his tractor and 4x4s.
He said:
This has the effect of reducing the emissions in the exhaust by 80%, as well as giving us between 15 to 20% more miles to the gallon.
‚ÄúIn my mind, this works well because there‚Äôs a big investment for things like tractors, and this allows us to use what we have for a small investment. ‚Äú
If we use batteries, you‚Äôre looking at four to six tonnes worth for a tractor, and you‚Äôd have to recharge it part way through the day. They use a huge amount of power.
As the number of onshore wind farms increases, farmers who have them on their land say they also could be used to harness another green technology, hydrogen.
Andrew Connon , the vice president of NFU Scotland, said:
You can use the renewables to produce hydrogen and If you have green hydrogen, you have a fuel source and its by-product, ammonia nitrate, which can be used as a fertiliser creating a circular economy for agriculture.
‚ÄúFinancial support and grant funding is needed though to allow this to be looked at on a bigger scale.‚Äù
The Scottish Government says they‚Äôre investing in hydrogen project pilots specific to farming and hopes lessons from them can be implemented in the future.
A spokesperson said:
Hydrogen will be a key part of the net zero journeys, and the Scottish Government published an action plan in 2022 with funding to develop projects to help our decarbonisation.
‚ÄúWe will take what we learn from these projects to roll out the opportunities more widely to benefit more farms and communities.‚Äù
Back in Aberdeenshire, and a small field just outside Scotland‚Äôs Rural and Agricultural Craibstone college is providing scientists with important soil data.
Crop trials there look at the pH of soil and emissions from ground-growing peas and barley.
The information gathered will help farmers decide what input their soil needs, with the hope that it will minimise the use of fertilisers. It will also be fed into a worldwide database.
Dr Robin Walker said:
We have boxes here that work as chambers looking for greenhouse gases, and the one we‚Äôre particularly interested in is nitrous oxide, which is 300 times more polluting than a carbon dioxide.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre doing this partly from a global warming perspective but also if you‚Äôre losing nitrogen from the system, it‚Äôs potentially not getting into the crop and being as productive as it needs to be.‚Äù
David said it‚Äôs vital that farmers address measures to cut costs and boost efficiency.
He added:
It is absolutely essential to our business to be as sustainable as possible.
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs not that big of a margin in the first place so the more efficient we can be, the better, the more we can get out of our fuel the tractors, that helps us and the climate.‚Äù

Farmers embrace green energy to boost efficiency of tractors ‚Äì Hydrogen electrolysis helps to cut emissions and allows heavy farming equipment to run for hours, source
